name: DRIDER

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The drider can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.text: While in sunlight, the drider has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.text: The drider ignores movement restrictions caused by webs, and the drider knows the location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The drider makes three attacks, using Foreleg or Poison Burst in any combination.

actions.name: Foreleg
actions.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 10 ft. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Piercing damage.

actions.name: Poison Burst
actions.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +6, range 120 ft. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) Poison damage.

bonus_actions.name: Magic of the Spider Queen (Recharge 5-6)
bonus_actions.text: The drider casts Darkness, Faerie Fire, or Web, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14).

Steward and Sage of Nature
Habitat: Any; Treasure: Individual, Relics
Druids use primal magic, traditional teachings, and bonds with animals and eldritch beings to guard the natural world and heal its ills. These magic-users
might be recluses devoted to a particular land, or they might be part of a mystic organization. Roll on or choose a result from the Druidic Traditions table to
inspire a druid’s magical practices.
Druid Traditions
1d6 	The Druid Is...
1 	An avenger who strikes against destructive civilizations and those who abuse nature.
2 	A guide who aids travelers in navigating the realms of Beasts, Fey, or Plants.
3 	A hermit who works alone to protect the lands, seas, or skies they call home.
4 	A mender who travels the world healing natural, magical, or manufactured disasters.
